ARTICLE I. - IN GENERAL 

Sec. 86-1. - Map of lines, poles and stubs in rights-of-way. 
    All city departments operating other than under the direct supervision of the city engineer, all utility companies, the public utilities board and other persons using the streets, curbs, avenues, alleys, sidewalks, public squares or other public rights-of-way, under franchise or contract with the city or authorization from the city commission, shall provide the city engineer with a map or drawing showing the location of all of its lines, poles, guy poles and guy stubs in the city streets, avenues, alleys, sidewalks, public squares, or other public rights-of-way and provide the city engineer additional maps or drawings as requested to bring such information up to date at least annually. 
(Code 1971, §§ 30-2, 30-37) 
Sec. 86-2. - Plantings and signs on U.S. 83 Expressway right-of-way. 
    No person shall plant or place any tree, shrub, vegetation, or any sign, commercial or private, or any post or advertising on the right-of-way of the U.S. 83 Expressway. 
(Code 1971, § 30-3) 
Sec. 86-3. - Discharge of water upon sidewalk, curb or gutter, street or alley. 
(a)  After ten days' written notice from either the city engineer, building official, or public health director, it shall be unlawful for any person to permit water from any hydrant, fountain, sink, washbowl, automobile repair or cleaning service, air conditioning cooling tower, or any other apparatus discharging water or other fluids, situated upon premises owned or controlled by such person, to run upon any sidewalk, curb or gutter, street or alley to be or to cause any sidewalk, curb or gutter, street or alley to become muddy or continuously wet. 
(b)  After ten days' written notice from either the city engineer, building official, or public health director, it shall be unlawful for any person who owns or controls premises upon which is located any apparatus which discharges water therefrom to cause the discharge of such water unless the discharge line from such apparatus is connected either to the sanitary sewer of the public utilities board or to the city storm sewer system as directed by the city engineer. After the ten-day written notice, any noncompliance of this section shall be a separate unlawful act. 
(Code 1971, §§ 30-18, 30-33) 
Cross reference- Utilities, ch. 102. 
Sec. 86-4. - Closure of streets. 
(a)  No person shall close or cause to be closed any street or alley within the city except for emergency repair of utility lines without first securing the permission of the city engineer. The city engineer shall, upon the closing of any street or alley, give immediate notice of such closing to the police department and fire department. Any person making emergency repairs shall immediately notify the city engineer of the location and the closing of any street or alley necessitated by such emergency repairs. 
(b)  No person shall close or cause to be closed any street or alley within the city, except for emergency repair of utility lines, without first securing the permission of the police department. 
(Code 1971, §§ 30-19, 30-34) 
Sec. 86-5. - Obstructions and encroachments. 
(a)  It shall be unlawful for any person to erect, place, build, construct or maintain any fence, gate, pole, post, sign, hedge, building, or other obstruction or encroachment upon any public street or alley or any portion of any public street or alley within the city or to cause any such thing to be done. 
(b)  The enumeration of certain types of obstructions and encroachments in subsection (a) of this section shall not limit the scope and effect of this section, but this section shall be construed to prohibit and forbid every type and kind of obstruction or encroachment upon any public street or alley of whatever nature or character, save and except for those facilities for the carrying of utilities as may be permitted under a contract, a franchise or by city ordinance for the use of its public streets and alleys for such purpose. 
(Code 1971, §§ 30-20, 30-35) 
Sec. 86-6. - Damage to or destruction of property placed by engineering or police department. 
    It is unlawful for any person to remove any post, stake, or other mark or marker indicating the line of any street, curb, avenue, sidewalk, alley, public square or other public right-of-way or to pull down, remove or deface any board, sign or plate indicating the name of any street or avenue or any other marker placed upon any such alley, street, curb, avenue, sidewalk, public square or other public right-of-way by the engineering department or the police department. A person violating this section shall be deemed guilty of a violation of this chapter. 
(Code 1971, § 30-30) 
Sec. 86-7. - Sale on streets, sidewalks, vacant lots restricted. 
(a)  It shall be unlawful for any person to expose for sale or to sell fruits, vegetables or other perishable farm products; candy, soda-pop, and other like refreshments; new or used vehicles; or goods, wares and merchandise or anything of value in the city along the street and outside of a permanent building used as a store or in a tent or other temporary covering that does not meet the requirements of the city building, electrical, plumbing or sanitation code or on any vacant lot located within the following described districts and streets: 
(1)  Along all streets located in an area bordered on the north by East Madison Street, on the south by the city limits, on the west by Palm Boulevard and on the east by International Boulevard; 
(2)  Along all of West Elizabeth Street; 
(3)  Along all of Palm Boulevard;

(13)  Along all of Southmost Road;

(15)  Along all of East Avenue;

(17)  Along West Jefferson Street from Palm Boulevard to Central Boulevard; 
(18)  Along U.S. Highway 281; 
(19)  Along all of Old Port Isabel Road; 
(20)  Along all of Old Alice Road; 
(21)  Along all of Coffee Port Road; 
(22)  Along all of McDavitt Boulevard; 
(23)  Along all of Lakeside Boulevard; 
(24)  Along all of Los Ebanos Boulevard;
